revised_title: An Unusual Darkness Event at Detroit in 1762
tldr: The author, James Stirling, describes a remarkable darkness event that occurred in Detroit in 1762. The darkness lasted for most of the day, and was accompanied by a red, enlarged sun, dirty yellowish-green colored air, and a shower of sulfuric rain. Stirling suggests that the event may have been caused by a volcanic eruption or subterranean fire.
